I'm thrilled to hear that! It's always exciting to try out a new recipe, especially when you're building on a successful foundation like your tomato soup.

Using the same broth as a base will definitely help to create a sense of continuity and familiarity in your new soup. The roasted carrots and ginger will add a unique twist, but the broth will provide a comforting and dependable flavor profile.

Remember, the key to a great soup is to taste and adjust as you go. Don't be afraid to add a pinch of this or a dash of that to get the flavor just right. And if you're feeling adventurous, you can always experiment with different spices or ingredients to make the soup your own.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I'll let you get started on your soup-making journey! Good luck, and I hope you enjoy every spoonful of your Creamy Carrot and Ginger Soup!
